intro: Lens orientalis, commonly known as the Persian bean, is a leguminous plant native to the Middle East and Central Asia. It produces small, lens-shaped seeds that are often used in traditional cuisines. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with trifoliate leaves and small white or pink flowers. Its seeds are rich in protein and have been cultivated for thousands of years. The botanical features of Lens orientalis make it an important crop in both agricultural and culinary contexts.
